{{also|Schläfen}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|slāfan}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*slēpaną}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*slab-||be weak, limp, languid}}, {{m|ine-pro|*slab-}}. Compare {{cog|nds|slapen}}, {{cog|nl|slapen}}, {{cog|en|sleep}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ˈʃlaːfn̩]|[ˈʃlaːfən]|[ˈʃlaːfɱ̩]}} * {{audio|de|De-schlafen.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-schlafen.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=7|schläft|schlief|geschlafen|past subjunctive=schliefe}} # to [[sleep]] #: {{ux|de|Ich habe diese Nacht gut '''geschlafen'''.|I '''slept''' well last night.}} #: {{ux|de|'''schlafen''' gehen|to go to '''sleep'''|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|sich '''schlafen''' legen|to lie down to '''sleep'''|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|with {{m|de|über}} + accusative}} to [[sleep on]] something; to wait and think before making a decision #: {{ux|de|Ich werde eine Nacht darüber '''schlafen'''.|I'll '''sleep''' on it tonight.}} # {{lb|de|with {{m|de|mit}}}} to [[sleep with]]; to [[have sex]] ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-auto|schlafen}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |ausschlafen |durchschlafen |einschlafen |entschlafen |hochschlafen |Schlaf |Schlafanzug |Schlafenszeit |Schläfer |schlaflos |schläfrig |Schlafstörung |Schlafzimmer |überschlafen |verschlafen |wegschlafen }} ===See also=== * {{l|de|schlummern}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
